intro: Acineta hagsateri, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, succulent-like growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in dry conditions. It blooms during the warmer months, typically from late spring to early autumn. Acineta hagsateri is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a hardy species suitable for xeriscaping.
